pr_title: Funqy azure and lambda http support

timeline.message:
funqy virtual http support

finish funqy http

tests

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this still be an error? Also with this failure now you won't get the stack trace.
timeline.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText:
Exception trace would pop up every single test run with the test harness.  Since we're now making the test harness public, this is kind of an issue.
You don't need a stack trace for SocketException as the error message would be good enough and you could infer where the error was.
replies.author: patriot1burke

replies.bodyText: Maybe you should check the launch mode and just don't log anything if it is TEST, as it sounds like you will still get the WARN in tests now?
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText: I just reverted this file.  Don't feel like arguing.
replies.author: patriot1burke

replies.bodyText: So there is always going to be a big stacktrace in the logs when running tests now?
replies.author: stuartwdouglas

replies.bodyText: For now.  I don't have time to update this PR as I'm working on something else at the moment. A contributor is working on Funqy so I'd like to get this PR in.
replies.author: patriot1burke
